value.title: Manage software delivery by using a release based workflow on GitHub
value.excerpt: Learn to implement a release based workflow on GitHub using project boards, branches, and releases.

value.title: Create and publish a static web app with Gatsby and Azure Static Web Apps
value.excerpt: Use Gatsby to develop and compile a static web app, then deploy it to the web with Azure Static Web Apps.

value.title: Using IoT Central with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365
value.excerpt: This module will focus on using IoT Central with Connected Field Service add-on for Dynamics 365 for Field Service.  The module will walk you through building an IoT Central application and escalating the alerts into Dynamics 365.

value.title: Work with DataFrames advanced methods in Azure Databricks
value.excerpt: Work with DataFrames advanced methods in Azure Databricks

value.title: Explore Natural Language Processing in Microsoft Azure
value.excerpt: Natural language processing supports applications that can see, hear, speak with, and understand users.  They permit the user to interact with your application in natural ways without requiring the user to adapt to the computer model.  Using text analytics, translation, and language understanding services, Microsoft Azure makes it easy to build applications that support natural language.

topItems.title: Analyze text with the Text Analytics service
topItems.excerpt: The Text Analytics service is a cloud-based service that provides advanced natural language processing over raw text for sentiment analysis, key phrase extraction, named entity recognition, and language detection.

topItems.title: Recognize and synthesize speech
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to recognize and synthesize speech by using Azure Cognitive Services.

topItems.title: Translate text and speech
topItems.excerpt: Automated translation capabilities in an AI solution enables closer collaboration by removing language barriers.

topItems.title: Create a language model with Language Understanding
topItems.excerpt: In this module, we'll introduce you to Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS) and show how to build and publish a LUIS model.

value.title: Explore natural language processing
value.excerpt: Natural language processing supports applications that can see, hear, speak with, and understand users.  Using text analytics, translation, and language understanding services, Microsoft Azure makes it easy to build applications that support natural language.

topItems.title: Translate text and speech

topItems.excerpt: In this module, we'll introduce you to Language Understanding Intelligent Service (LUIS) and show how to build and publish a LUIS model.

value.title: Build and query a Delta Lake
value.excerpt: Build and query a Delta Lake

value.title: Monitor cloud resources
value.excerpt: Cloud Admin course from Dr. Majd Sakr at Carnegie Mellon University. Monitoring how your cloud resources are performing is crucial to building reliable cloud applications. This module covers what monitoring is, why you need to do it, and how you can about monitoring your resources.

value.title: Share cloud resources
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Get an introduction to virtualization, one of the many technologies that power the cloud. Learn what virtualization is, its benefits, and how cloud resources are shared.

value.title: Communicate effectively on GitHub by using Markdown
value.excerpt: Learn to use Markdown to communicate with brevity, clarity, and expression.

value.title: Create and manipulate tables using the datascience library
value.excerpt: Learn the basics of table manipulation in the datascience library

value.title: Design and plot graphs in Python
value.excerpt: Learn

value.title: Work with users, groups, and roles in custom apps and APIs
value.excerpt: In this module, youâ€™ll learn how to use both Azure AD Groups and Application Roles to provide fine grained access control to an application.

value.title: Introduction to Python for space exploration
value.excerpt: Get an introduction to the types of space exploration problems that Python and data science can influence.

value.title: Introduction to Azure Migrate for server migration
value.excerpt: Discover how Azure Migrate helps you realize the benefits of moving your on-premises VMware or Hyper-V server workloads to Azure infrastructure as a service (IaaS). Learn the process for migrating your workload agent-less, all within the hub.

value.title: Settle competing commits by using merge conflict resolution on GitHub
value.excerpt: Learn to settle overlapping commits across branches by using merge conflict resolution.

value.title: Migrate on-premises workloads to Azure
value.excerpt: Migrate on-premises workloads to Azure

value.title: Remotely monitor and service equipment with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
value.excerpt: Configure IoT devices to remotely monitor customer equipment.

value.title: Search and organize repository history by using GitHub
value.excerpt: Learn to search and organize repository history by using filters, blame, and cross-linking on GitHub.

value.title: Solve optimization problems by using quantum-inspired optimization
value.excerpt: Learn how quantum-inspired algorithms mimic quantum physics to solve difficult optimization problems.

value.title: Explore computer vision in Microsoft Azure
value.excerpt: Computer vision is an area of artificial intelligence (AI) in which software systems are designed to perceive the world visually, though cameras, images, and video. There are multiple specific types of computer vision problem that AI engineers and data scientists can solve using a mix of custom machine learning models and platform-as-a-service (PaaS) solutions - including many cognitive services in Microsoft Azure.

topItems.title: Analyze images with the Computer Vision service
topItems.excerpt: The Computer Vision service enables software engineers to create intelligent solutions that extract information from images; a common task in many artificial intelligence (AI) scenarios.

topItems.title: Classify images with the Custom Vision service
topItems.excerpt: Image classification is a common workload in artificial intelligence (AI) applications. It harnesses the predictive power of machine learning to enable AI systems to identify real-world items based on images.

topItems.title: Detect objects in images with the Custom Vision service
topItems.excerpt: Object detection is a form of computer vision in which artificial intelligence (AI) agents can identify and locate specific types of object in an image or camera feed.

topItems.title: Detect and analyze faces with the Face service
topItems.excerpt: Face detection, analysis, and recognition is an important capability for artificial intelligence (AI) solutions. The Face cognitive service in Azure makes it easy integrate these capabilities into your applications.

value.title: Run Azure for SAP workloads
value.excerpt: This learning path augments existing knowledge around the deployment methodologies for SAP workloads in Azure, focusing on Azure Marketplace and custom images using the Azure portal, Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates, and Azure PowerShell cmdlets.

value.title: Azure Spring Cloud workshop
value.excerpt: In this workshop, you'll go through tasks to deploy Spring Boot microservices to Azure Spring Cloud (ASC).

value.title: Build Serverless APIs with Azure Functions
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to build a Serverless API using Azure Functions. You'll connect that API to Azure Cosmos DB, deploy the API to Azure and finish with a fully functional web application.

value.title: Build a web API with Node.js and Express
value.excerpt: Use Express for Node.js to build RESTful APIs. Create and configure middleware to add things like logging and authentication/authorization.

value.title: Foundations of cloud computing for developers
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Discover what the cloud is, the history of cloud computing, what types of clouds are available, and how you might use the cloud.

value.title: Get started with Connected Field Service for Dynamics 365 and Azure IoT
value.excerpt: This module will focus on the initial deployment of the Connected Field Service add-on for Dynamics 365 for Field Service.  The module will walk you through the installation and an understanding of the components installed as part of the out of the box template application.

value.title: Build and deploy applications to Azure by using GitHub Actions
value.excerpt: Create two deployment workflows using GitHub Actions and Microsoft Azure.

value.title: Build continuous integration (CI) workflows by using GitHub Actions
value.excerpt: Learn how to create workflows that enable you to use Continuous Integration (CI) for your projects.

value.title: Permissions and Consent Framework
value.excerpt: Learn the basics of Microsoft identity including the different types of tokens, account types, and supported topologies.
